intro: Campanula annae, commonly known as the Annae bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Campanula annae prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and alpine settings.
